main event: Trained balloon observers at Holloman AFB, N. M. reported a dramatic sighting of a gray-white ornamental object in 1948.
interesting points: The object was observed for 30 seconds as it completed a large loop after a downward descent, then soared upward and disappeared suddenly.
The observers were trained balloon observers, adding credibility to the report.
The sighting took place at Holloman AFB, indicating a military presence in the area.
The object was described as an ornamental ground type, suggesting it was not perceived as a conventional aircraft or natural phenomenon.
The report was documented using Security AFO Form 329, adding an official record of the event.
